A Few Remarkable Issues Regarding martial arts houston

MMA Fight Gear And Its Popularity

The publics love of violence is insatiable. This is probably why MMA fighting is becoming so popular. You have two men going after the title, and they are allowed to beat the crap out of each other. It really makes you forget about whatever problems you may have. Influenced by the sport there are MMA fights popping up all over. Young guys think if they can do it, so can I. There is an increasing need for MMA fight gear among the youth of our nations. They are going out and buying the shirts, the gloves, and pretty much anything they think will help them look like a professional MMA fighter.

Mixed Martial Arts Fighting is quickly becoming as popular as football in some places. Everyone had their favorite fighter. People are betting on the ones they think will rise to the top. You can usually see the fight in your local bar on pay-per-view fight nights; because they know that it will draw a crowd. For some people watching fighting and drinking beer goes hand in hand.

The gloves and tape protect your fists from cuts and fractures when you are fighting. Other things you can purchase from online stores or the shops include punching bags, t shirts, sweatshirts, socks, and pretty much anything they can put a Mixed Martial Arts logo on.

The reality show that followed amateur fighters around as they tried to make it has only added to its popularity. Everyone has a favorite fighter, and they love to see him or her win. You can look like your favorite fighter when sparring with your friends. This is the appeal to people young and old. The desire to get out there and show the world that you are the best is in every person.

For the most part MMA gear does not do much to protect the fighter, but it is necessary to be an efficient fighter. The gloves are to protect your fists when you punch and can protect your hand from being cut and the fight having to be stopped. Both the male and female fighters are required to wear mouth guards and the men must wear a cup. Shorts made for fighting allow for a lot of movement in the legs.

MMA fighting has only been around as a public sport since 1993 but it has gained popularity faster than any sport so far. The style of fighting is very complex, and the scoring so interesting that people were immediately drawn to this new style of sport. They quickly picked their favorite fighters and followed them all the way to the top. MMA replaced the way people used to feel about boxing. Boxing has stopped gaining momentum right about the time MMA first came out.

Boxing was something that took the world by storm when it came out, and people were enthralled by fighting then. MMA fighting has just taken that to another level. The style puts people in the mind of a street fight, and that is part of the appeal. People love to see other people getting hurt, as sick as that it. You can get Mixed Martial Arts gear at sporting goods and martial art supply stores all over the country, and even online.

At Least Two Awesome Things On The Subject Of martial arts h

MMA's early years UFC 21

Throughout the years, Mixed Martial Arts has been picking up a lot of steam. Many of the big fights of today are watched by millions of people around the world. Although MMA has been getting more popular as of late, it has been around for quite a long time and even had quite a following in the past couple decades. The UFC, or Ultimate Fighting Championship, has been holding fights for years to try and get this sport out to the masses. One of the more memorable events held in the last decade and a half was the UFC 21: Return of the Champions event held on July 16, 1999.

This mixed martial art event was held at the Five Seasons Events Center that is located out in Cedar Rapids, Iowa. When it was first shown in the United States it could only be seen live on pay per view. Since then, it has been released on DVD for avid fans and followers. One of the biggest things that went on at UFC 21 was the changes in rules. In this event, all of the preliminary bouts would consist of two five minute rounds. The main fights of the night would be three five minute rounds and the final Championship round could go as long as five minute rounds. These rule changes made the sport more similar to the USA's unified rules of combat. The other major rule change to happen in the event was that it was the first UFC fight to bring in the 10 point must system that is often used in boxing. This was to help them better judge the fights.

There were 8 bouts in this even, with 4 of them being heavyweight bouts, three of them being middleweight, and then a lightweight championship bout. The lightweight Championship bout was between Pat Miletech of the United States against Andre Pederneiras from Brazil. The match ended with Miletich winning by TKO. The doctor stopped the fight after a cut became too large to continue. There were two preliminary heavyweight bouts, the first being between Travis Fulton and David Dodd. The fight was decided after the two five minute rounds in favor of Fulton by unanimous decision. The next preliminary heavyweight bout was between Ron Waterman and Andre Roberts. This one didn't even last past the first round as Roberts won with a KO at 2:41.

The first middleweight bout was between Royce Alger and Eugene Jackson where Jackson won by a KO in the second found at 1:17. Following that was the heavyweight bout between Jim Lajcik of the United States and Tsuyoshi Kosaka of Japan. The Japanese fighter came away with the victory after the doctor stopped the fight because Jim had a concussion. The next two middleweight bouts were between Paul Jones and Flavio Luiz Moura, and Jeremy Horn and Daiju Takase. Jones won the first match pulling a rear naked choke and putting his opponent into submission while Horn won the second bout after Horn got a TKO for his fierce striking ability. The very last heavyweight bout was between Maurice Smith and Marco Ruas where Smith won by injuring Marco's knee at 5:00 in the very first round.

AUTHOR:- Jared Burgess writes reviews on various sporting events including the .

3 Amazing Factors Which Involves martial arts houston

What Is Mixed Martial Arts - Mma

You have probably heard of karate or judo. But did you know that there is such a thing called mixed martial arts?

Mixed martial arts or MMA is a full contact combat support which allows players to fight in a competition using various fighting techniques. The rules allow the fighters to use various striking and grappling techniques both while standing and on the ground.

But MMA was first introduced by the Greeks in 648 B.C. Back then, it was called the pankration which was introduced into the Olympic Games. Records show that there was a similar version of this in the 1800's which continued on in the early 1900's until the MMA came out in 1993 with the establishment of the Ultimate Fighting Championship or UFC.

The difference between the MMA and those in the past is that this was initially created to find out which hand to hand combat technique works best to fight in a combat situation so fighters of various disciplines were gathered. During that time, there were only a few rules but more than 10 years later, additional ones were adopted to increase the safety of those who computed and to promote the sport.

Today, you can see the Ultimate Fighting Championship on television. Research shows that mixed martial arts is now more popular today than boxing especially when more people were willing to pay to see it on pay per view channels surpassing wrestling and boxing.

There are now 5 weight classes namely lightweight which is 67 to 70 kg, welterweight which is 71 to 77kg, middleweight from 78 to 84 kg, light heavyweight from 85 to 93 kg and heavy weight from 94 to 120 kg. There are 4 other weight classes but these are not currently being used by the UFC.

How someone wins in mixed martial arts is pretty simple. If the opponent taps the floor, the match is over. The same happens if the opponent is knocked unconscious. Should both fighters still be standing at the end of the match, the winner will be decided by the judges.

Illegal contact with the other opponent is called a foul. The referee inside the ring may deduct points from one player or even disqualify that person if the act committed was intentional or no contest if this was unintentional.

One of the biggest differences in mixed martial arts is the ring where the fighters play. Unlike a boxing or wrestling ring that is shaped in a rectangle, competition here is done in an octagon shaped cage. The eight sided structure has walls of metal chain link fence coated with black vinyl. There is padding around the top of the fence and between each of the eight sections as well as two entry-exit gates which are opposite each other.

Competitors who enter the ring have to wear proper attire. This means going into the ring with approved shorts and no shoes. Gloves must also be approved and have at least an inch of padding around the knuckles so the person will still be able to use his fingers and grab the opponent without the risk of injuring the hand.

Is mixed martial arts nice to watch? The answer is yes given that there are now more people watching it and others who want to join the competition.

A Number Of Astounding Issues Around martial arts houston

Various different styles of fighting are a part of it. Irrespective of the fact of the variations in the style of fighting, most of the gears required for each of them are similar to a great extent. Also some of the MMA gear needs to be worn both while practicing as well as during competitions.

There are a lot of gears available to choose from. To start with, it is not necessary for a player to possess each and every gear. They must however have certain essential gears. To start with, gloves are one of the most essential gears required. Most of the fighting styles requires the use of hands. Thus it is necessary to provide optimum protection to it. It is also mandatory for the gloves to be worn at the time of matches. The choice of wearing the gloves at the time of practice is upon the player. However, the people who do not use them subject their hands to the risk of getting injured. Records would definitely reveal the number of people who must have got the bones of their fingers or their knuckles broken by not wearing gloves at the time of practise.

One of the other vital gears would be the mouth guard. Any person would surely not like to get their teeth broken at the time of practice or at the time of matches. It is the mouth guards that come to the rescue in such times. Thus one should go for purchasing the best possible mouth guard. It is necessary for the mouth guard to be fitting appropriately for it to perform its function well. One needs to follow the directions specified for the mouth guard to function in a proper way. Following the guidelines in a proper way is thus important. It basically involves putting the mouth guard into boiling water and then putting it into the mouth so that it gains the shape of the mouth.

One of the other essential gears is the MMA shorts. It comes in various types and sizes. However, the most important factor that needs to be given a consideration is comfort. One should buy the one they feel the most comfortable in. The people who are a little bigger in size usually consider buying the short that have a slit on the sides. The people involved in the activity of grappling usually buy the rip proof shorts. Shorts like these are made up of strong cotton that is woven strongly.

It is also advisable to wear rash guards. This is one of the other gears that most people prefer wearing. It normally clings to the body due to the fact that it is manufactured by using a stretchy material. They are often worn underneath the clothes that are worn at the time of matches or during practice. The main objective of this gear is to avoid the formation of diseases like ring worm and staph that are mat borne. Their sleeves can either be short or long. It is however advisable to wear the long sleeve one for optimum protection.

The gears can be purchased either online or from one of the shops that stock them. There are both benefits and drawbacks associated with each of these options. Visit

4 Wonderful Issues That Is Related To martial arts houston

It has gained popularity in the last decade. The Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC) is the largest MMA promotion company worldwide. This is one of the intensive styles of fighting. Combatants have to go for striking and grappling both on the ground and while standing. One may find it's roots in olympics of ancient times. Rival sports of MMA are boxing and wrestling. This sport needs a lot of energy.

Rules and etiquette of MMA

Like any other sport, this has rules and etiquette too. Moves of MMA should be practiced by the person against the other person who has practiced the same. They should not be used against a person, who has not been aware of them or has not learnt them. They are needed to respect their instructor. Instructor's instructions should be followed. When the players are exercising their moves, the others should not cause distraction. Their uniforms must be clean. During the match, when one person is defeated, it should be taken in the positive way. Both the sportsmen are supposed to be maintaining the sportsman spirit. Life-threatening moves are not to be performed by anyone. The safety is the major issue, which should be taken into consideration by each player during the fight. Excessive aggression is not desirable during the match.

MMA gloves-Why necessary?

Hands are most used in this sport to perfrom various moves. They are supposed to be given full protection. Which is why, MMA gloves are significant. Without these, there is a possibility for getting hands injured, if they are used without any protection. There are different types of MMA gloves available in the market. They are sparring gloves, bag gloves, Fight gloves etc. Sparring gloves are used during practice, normally. Further, they are designed to protect both the fighters in the sport. The wrist support is increased by using bag gloves. Fight gloves are designed for the real fight. They are not just means to fight, but are truly best assets to have. When it comes to surrendering the opponent, there are grappling techniques that are supposed to be used. It is very essential to have MMA Gears that help in doing these moves perfectly. MMA gloves are surely different, as they are expected to have more shock absorbing capacity. Multilayer gloves are surely known to be shock absorbent. As far as amateur competition is concerned, MMA gloves are expected to be light weight. Cage style wrestling is definitely in fashion. More fashionable gloves are used in this type of fighting match.

Wondering about buying right MMA gloves?

Due to the preference given to this sport day-by-day, there are many companies that started producing MMA gloves. Each product is different and there is a uniqueness. There is a fixed criteria to determine how to choose the best MMA gloves. Every combatant has to see what he wants in it. One should think of brand quality, price etc while selecting MMA gloves. There is a lot written about it. As you surf the net, you can find tons of information and reviews published in form of blogs and articles on this topic. There are trainers and instructors, who will certainly provide directions to you in this context. Visit

3 Incredible Issues On The Subject Of martial arts houston

The belts are part of the Jiu Jitsu uniform, and the belt color signifies how advanced the practitioner is with technical skill and knowledge. This system is similar to that of the martial art of Judo which also uses different colored belts to signify rank or skill level.

The colors of the different belts for adults are white, blue, purple, brown, black, black and red, and red. The junior belt colors for those under age 16 are white, grey, yellow, orange, and green. There is also a stripe award for those in the same belt rank. For example, a practitioner that has a blue belt with three stripes is more skillful than a blue belt with two stripes.

White Jiu Jitsu Belts signify the initial or beginner rank for Jiu Jitsu students. There is no prerequisite to wearing the Brazilian Jiu Jitsu white belt. The next belt in the series is blue, and the beginner must demonstrate a well-rounded set of skills that include defensive positioning, escape and survival techniques, and elementary offensive moves like guard passes and common submissions.

It is estimated to take between one to two years to earn a blue belt. It requires a huge amount of technical knowledge about Brazilian Jiu Jitsu as well as efficient implementation of these moves. The International Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Federation or IBJJF has declared that a practitioner must be at least age 16 to earn a blue belt and officially start with the adult belt system.

Purple Jiu Jitsu Belts are considered to be the intermediate ranking in adult Jiu-Jitsu. It usually takes three or more years of blue belt training to earn a purple belt. Generally the rank of purple belt is held longer than most other ranks. They are usually qualified to instruct practitioners at the lower belt levels.

The average amount of time it takes to go from purple to brown belt is two to three years. The brown belt is considered to be a transition between the intermediate purple belt and the elite black belt. At this point the practitioner already has the needed practical and technical skills, but time is spent refining and honing these skills to reach the black belt level.

Black Jiu Jitsu Belts take between two to three years to earn from the brown belt, and it signifies an expert level of skill. Black belts advance through a series of degrees, and a 7th or 8th degree black belt may be awarded the black and red belt. This belt alternates between the colors or red and black, and it is sometimes called the "coral belt." These practitioners are very experienced and have made an impact on the art of Jiu Jitsu.

Finally, the red belt is awarded to those who have such fame and influence in the art that it has carried them to the highest successes. Based on the IBJJF's graduation system, it is said that the earliest one could receive the a 9th degree red belt is at 67 years old! Better late than never!

Fighter's Market offers a wide variety of Jiu Jitsu and MMA gear for the BJJ Gi and MMA training athlete as well as MMA apparel for fans. Whether your goal is to fight in the UFC or win a jiu jitsu championship you'll need , gi pants, , and other MMA clothing.

Two Additional Awesome Items Which Involves martial arts hou

Since 2003 this on again, off again match up has teased fans of both the UFC and Pride fighting championships, but now it looks like the fight may be on again.

UFC 79 on December 29th, 2007 is the rumored date for the fight to take place. The venue is in Las Vegas and the anticipation could not be any higher. It's true that both Wanderlei and Chuck are coming off back to back losses, but when you look at those losses and the quality of opposition it's clear that both of these guys are still at the top of their game.

Wanderlei Silva has fought an absolute who's who of 205lb mixed martial artists and won the vast majority of those battles. He's defeated Quinton Jackson twice in dominant fashion, defeated Dan Henderson, Ricardo Arona, Kazushi Sakuraba, but has yet to face the best of the "new" UFC. How will Wanderlei match up against Chuck Liddell, Keith Jardine, Houston Alexander or Forrest Griffin? I personally think that Wanderlei's strength, power and aggression is difficult for any fighter to deal with. He has a wild style that could either make it a very easy night for Chuck, or the worst night of Chuck Liddell's career.

Wanderlei likes to throw looping heavy punches, much like Chuck does, although Chuck's are just a touch straighter. The difference is in the clinch and ground game where I believe that Wanderlei Silva has a distinct advantage over Liddell. If Wanderlei gets Chuck in at close quarters it will be a very tough night for Liddell and three losses in a row may spell retirement for the "Ice Man".

Chuck Liddell needs no introduction to mixed martial arts and especially UFC fans. He has defeated two legends of the sport twice each. With big wins over Randy Couture and Tito Ortiz, Chuck Liddell established himself as the UFC's top light heavyweight player for much of the last three years. However, Chuck is coming off of two losses. The first was a flash knockout loss to Quinton "Rampage" Jackson, with that loss the belt changed hands and Quinton became the new light heavyweight champ.

Chuck's second loss is more interesting. It came to Keith Jardine, now most MMA fans would argue that Jardine is strong and tough, but Chuck went into that fight as the favorite. The fight was close and the judges gave the decision to Jardine. There wasn't a single take down in the fight meaning that Chuck, formerly the most feared striker at 205lbs has been beaten twice in a row, both time on his feet.

In the fight with Wanderlei Silva, if Chuck can keep his composure and land some big straight shots inside of Wandy's wild looping punches he can make a short night's work. Chuck hits very hard, but most of his really hard shots seem to be looping overhand rights, I don't think those will be particularly effective against Wanderlei Silva; Chuck needs to throw straight. Also, Chuck Liddell should avoid the clinch with Wanderlei at all costs, if he needs more incentive he should watch Wandy's two fights with Quinton Jackson.

Let's all just hope that this fight happens as the rumors state on December 29th. I'm not picking a winner or a favorite in this fight, I just want to see it happen.

So, what goes into the process of buying MMA shorts? The first step in the process involves purchasing shorts that have features built in to manage moisture. Moisture can be good and bad. That means that you are less able to perform at your highest level. These materials also keep you cool through the process.

When it comes to buying these shorts, you may be interested in buying items that have great looking designs or cool looks. However, that is not always the important thing. You will need to look for those that have a medium to heavy feel to them because this provides you with enough substance to keep you dry and comfortable. You may also want to look for those shorts with reinforced stitching. This adds to the overall performance and keeps your shorts from ripping. Durability is a big factor as well.

All of these things play a role in the process of buying these shorts. Keep in mind that quality matters the most but most manufacturers of high quality products know you want a great look, too. There are some outstanding products on the market that are a bit more expensive than the off brand, poor quality items. However, these will last significantly longer. They can be one of the best products possible. You still need to do all of the hard work, but the right shorts make that easier for you to accomplish.

A Set Of Remarkable Things Regarding martial arts houston

Don't focus on just strength training! Many MMA fighters have a training routine which consists of nothing but strength training. Yes it's nice to be able to have enough upper body strength for a major knockout punch, but what if the fight goes to the ground? You need to rely on more than just upper body strength. Train EVERY part of you. Develop your lower body strength, improve your running speed, your hand eye coordination, etc. This may sound like an obvious tip, but you'd be surprised how many people don't follow this tip and spend all of their training time focusing just on developing a better punch.

2. Focus on training in more than just one style. This kind of goes with the first tip. This isn't boxing, this is MMA. There are all different styles and you need to be prepared for them. If you rely mostly on boxing skills and you face someone who is skilled in submissions, you're going to be in big trouble. Try to have an understanding of wrestling, judo, leg kicks, etc.

3. Train for ground fighting. This is so important. Like I've said, you need to train in many different styles and parts of your body. But if there is one area to focus most of the time on, it would be ground fighting. Seriously, watch an MMA event. You'll notice just how many fights go to the ground. You need to be prepared for this. You need to know how to escape if someone has the mount position on you. You also need to know how to force a submission if you have the mount and you are losing energy after throwing multiple punches. DON'T skip ground graining!

4. Don't bother spending too much of your time with punching bags. Use your time to train with a live partner and focus on takedowns. If you can master the art of the takedown, you can easily take your opponent down and finish the fight. Remember, when it comes to ground fighting, the person who ends up in the mount position is usually the one who went for the takedown. Don't wait for them to take you down. Make the move.

5. Recognize your weaknesses and don't fret over them. If you have a weakness for kicks, don't obsess over trying to fix your weakness. Every fighter has a weakness in some part of their fighting style. Sure, it's good to practice and try to improve your skills in your weak area. But, you can also make up that lack of skill with skill in speed and takedowns.

Hopefully you have learned something from these 5 tips. If you didn't notice, these tips generally have the same theme of technique over power. If you don't believe this is true, just take a look at some of Royce Gracie's older fights. Back when there weren't weight limits, Royce Gracie sometimes fought against fighters that were 200+ pounds bigger than him, but Royce Gracie would still get the win. Royce knew how to take them down and he knew how to make them submit. Follow his example.

A Set Of Astounding Issues Around martial arts houston

Best Mma Workout Techniques Used By Top Trainers

MMA workout is popular because of the superior fitness, explosive strength, and physique of fighters. The better the skills during the training, the better is the shape of muscles, speed, and agility. It helps to develop physical and psychological strength, speed, makes one more adaptive to stress, and inculcates discipline. Everyday trainers are inventing new and innovative exercises to further enhance the strength and endurance of mixed martial art lovers. You can find customized packages that include a variety of intensive physical activities to keep one in perfect shape.

What Top MMA Workout Includes

Just attending the gym and lifting weights is not enough to give benefits of MMA workout. You need to follow proper conditioning and various techniques. The following points illustrate some popular mixed martial art workouts prescribed by top trainers.

Superior conditionings are essential part of MMA workout. It includes a number of low intensity exercises, such as running, jugging, press-ups, stretching, dips and jumping jacks. Gyms even have exercise bikes for better warm-ups.
Bag Work is a popular mixed martial art workout. Fighters practice hitting, punching, and kicking any solid target to develop strength. Mostly rubber or sand bags are used for MMA workout.
Weight training exercises are of two kinds. During training, you can use equipment, such as dumbbells. However, it is utmost important that you use your bodyweight in to the maximum.
Cardio improvement exercises are also extensively used by trainers. It includes running, cycling, and circuit training programs.
Core exercises with focus on strength training are also used extensively to build six-pack body and abs.
Innovative density training, interval training, biceps and triceps workouts, and hypertrophy exercises are also used widely by trainers.

Maximize Benefits From MMA Workout

A slew of measures can enhance your mixed martial art output and performance.

Always follow a progression scheme during MMA workout. Trainers advise participants to join basic courses and gradually increase the intensity of workouts.
Ensure that mixed martial art workouts focus on biomotor abilities in our body. Enhanced strength, endurance, speed, agility, co-ordination, and balance are keys to ultimate fitness.
Keep space for rest and recovery in your routine both in short and long-term planning. Follow your daily mixed martial art workouts with slow down exercise. Also keep two to three days every week to give your body the opportunity to rest and recuperate.
Warm-ups are a must to enhance advantages of MMA training. It conditions the body and mind.
Psychological training also influences outcome of workouts. It provides motivation and help control emotions during intense exercises.
Proper diet increases the physical stamina and level of endurance of fighters. As mixed martial art workout demands high physical endurance, adequate intake of protein and carbohydrate is essential.

MMA workout changes the persona if followed with right guidance. It is different from ordinary exercises in form, intensity, and results. A personalized plan helps to conserve energy and acquire skills. You can incorporate specific drills, train yourself, and develop the best physical shape.
